intro: Canistrum lanigerum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety coating. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas due to its adaptability. Canistrum lanigerum is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of fiber.
